AttachInstances.description: This example attaches the specified instance to the specified Auto Scaling group.
AttachInstances.title: To attach an instance to an Auto Scaling group

AttachLoadBalancerTargetGroups.description: This example attaches the specified target group to the specified Auto Scaling group.
AttachLoadBalancerTargetGroups.title: To attach a target group to an Auto Scaling group

AttachLoadBalancers.description: This example attaches the specified load balancer to the specified Auto Scaling group.
AttachLoadBalancers.title: To attach a load balancer to an Auto Scaling group

AttachTrafficSources.description: This example attaches the specified target group to the specified Auto Scaling group.
AttachTrafficSources.title: To attach a target group to an Auto Scaling group

CancelInstanceRefresh.description: This example cancels an instance refresh operation in progress.
CancelInstanceRefresh.title: To cancel an instance refresh

CompleteLifecycleAction.description: This example notifies Auto Scaling that the specified lifecycle action is complete so that it can finish launching or terminating the instance.
CompleteLifecycleAction.title: To complete the lifecycle action

CreateAutoScalingGroup.description: This example creates an Auto Scaling group.
CreateAutoScalingGroup.title: To create an Auto Scaling group

CreateAutoScalingGroup.description: This example creates an Auto Scaling group and attaches the specified target group.
CreateAutoScalingGroup.title: To create an Auto Scaling group with an attached target group

CreateAutoScalingGroup.description: This example creates an Auto Scaling group with a mixed instances policy. It specifies the c5.large, c5a.large, and c6g.large instance types and defines a different launch template for the c6g.large instance type.
CreateAutoScalingGroup.title: To create an Auto Scaling group with a mixed instances policy

CreateAutoScalingGroup.description: This example creates an Auto Scaling group using attribute-based instance type selection. It requires the instance types to have a minimum of four vCPUs and a maximum of eight vCPUs, a minimum of 16,384 MiB of memory, and an Intel manufactured CPU.
CreateAutoScalingGroup.title: To create an Auto Scaling group using attribute-based instance type selection

CreateLaunchConfiguration.description: This example creates a launch configuration.
CreateLaunchConfiguration.title: To create a launch configuration

CreateOrUpdateTags.description: This example adds two tags to the specified Auto Scaling group.
CreateOrUpdateTags.title: To create or update tags for an Auto Scaling group

DeleteAutoScalingGroup.description: This example deletes the specified Auto Scaling group.
DeleteAutoScalingGroup.title: To delete an Auto Scaling group

DeleteAutoScalingGroup.description: This example deletes the specified Auto Scaling group and all its instances.
DeleteAutoScalingGroup.title: To delete an Auto Scaling group and all its instances

DeleteLaunchConfiguration.description: This example deletes the specified launch configuration.
DeleteLaunchConfiguration.title: To delete a launch configuration

DeleteLifecycleHook.description: This example deletes the specified lifecycle hook.

DeleteNotificationConfiguration.description: This example deletes the specified notification from the specified Auto Scaling group.

DeletePolicy.description: This example deletes the specified Auto Scaling policy.

DeleteScheduledAction.description: This example deletes the specified scheduled action from the specified Auto Scaling group.

DeleteTags.description: This example deletes the specified tag from the specified Auto Scaling group.
DeleteTags.title: To delete a tag from an Auto Scaling group

ExitStandby.description: This example moves the specified instance out of standby mode.
ExitStandby.title: To move instances out of standby mode

PutLifecycleHook.description: This example creates a lifecycle hook for instance launch.
PutLifecycleHook.title: To create a launch lifecycle hook

PutNotificationConfiguration.description: This example adds the specified notification to the specified Auto Scaling group.
PutNotificationConfiguration.title: To add an Auto Scaling notification

PutScalingPolicy.description: This example adds the specified policy to the specified Auto Scaling group.

PutScheduledUpdateGroupAction.description: This example adds the specified scheduled action to the specified Auto Scaling group.

PutWarmPool.description: This example creates a warm pool for the specified Auto Scaling group.

RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat.description: This example records a lifecycle action heartbeat to keep the instance in a pending state.

ResumeProcesses.description: This example resumes the specified suspended scaling process for the specified Auto Scaling group.

SetDesiredCapacity.description: This example sets the desired capacity for the specified Auto Scaling group.

SetInstanceHealth.description: This example sets the health status of the specified instance to Unhealthy.

SetInstanceProtection.description: This example disables instance protection for the specified instance.

StartInstanceRefresh.description: This example starts an instance refresh for the specified Auto Scaling group.

SuspendProcesses.description: This example suspends the specified scaling process for the specified Auto Scaling group.

TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup.description: This example terminates the specified instance from the specified Auto Scaling group without updating the size of the group. Auto Scaling launches a replacement instance after the specified instance terminates.
TerminateInstanceInAutoScalingGroup.title: To terminate an instance in an Auto Scaling group

UpdateAutoScalingGroup.description: This example updates multiple properties at the same time.
UpdateAutoScalingGroup.title: To update an Auto Scaling group
